title: Analysis of the Impact of Example Learning and Problem-Solving Sequences on Learning Outcomes

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts and intermediate-level understanding of specialized fields (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: Learning mathematical problem-solving strategies in digital device-enabled environments, centered on cases linked to professional practice

learning_goals: Experimental data can demonstrate that the Example Study (EE) and Example-Problem Pair (EP) methods are superior to the Problem-Example Pair (PE) and Problem-Solving Only (PP) approaches in terms of learning efficiency (performance per unit time) and effectiveness (exam performance).
Optimal learning sequences and methods can be selected based on learning motivation (self-efficacy, task interest) and cognitive load considerations.

In blended learning environments, learners will design ≥3 example-problem pair learning models using digital tools (e.g., Google Jamboard, GeoGebra), apply them to real-class scenarios, and achieve ≥80% satisfaction in learner feedback surveys.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
